TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village of NORP , GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s husband , who worked as an electrician at the construction site , died as a result of a work - related accident . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the Dzerzhynsky District Court of ORG against a joint stock company “ T.”(“the company ” ) claiming compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage sustained as a result of his death .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to ORG , which on DATE allowed in part the applicant ’s claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment . It became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the amendments to the Code of Civil Procedure entered into force . They provided a right to lodge a cassation appeal within a DATE period with ORG against court decisions adopted before DATE and which had entered into force before that date . On DATE the company lodged an appeal in cassation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decisions of the lower courts and remitted the case for a fresh consideration to the first instance court .
CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings before the first instance court CARDINAL other companies and the local department of ORG ( “ the Fund ” ) were joined as co - defendants .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG found in part for the applicant . The court awarded her , inter alia , ORG ( about EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) to be paid by the Fund .

CARDINAL . The ORG appealed against that judgment ; however , on DATE ORG declined its appeal as lodged out of time . The ORG appealed in cassation . On DATE ORG , sitting as a court of cassation , quashed that decision and remitted the matter of the admissibility of the appeal for a fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partly allowed the appeal by the ORG and ruled that the above amount of ORG ORG should be paid by the company and not by the ORG . It upheld the remainder of the judgment .
